Founder of the Pala Dynasty

Gopala was the founder of the Pala dynasty. His rise is unique in Indian history as he was chosen not through military conquest, but through a process akin to a democratic election.

тЪЦя╕П
End of Matsya Nyaya

To end the anarchy prevalent in Bengal after the death of Shashanka (termed 'Matsya Nyaya', where the big fish eat the small), the common people or chieftains elected him as king.

тШ╕я╕П
Religion and Odantapuri

He was a follower of Buddhism and established the famous Odantapuri Mahavihara (monastery/university) in Bihar Sharif.
